body_html:
Yes I have the same issue as well Unfortunately, the loss growth is still there even when I run it with python2
…
On Mon, 22 Jan 2018 at 6:02 PM, gloriouskilka ***@***.***> wrote: Glad I've found this issue. I noticed strange loss growth and almost immediate fall back after I stoppped and run training again from last checkpoint. I can't switch to python2 as my development machine has Windows, and there are no tensorflow windows python2 support. — You are receiving this because you commented.  Glad I've found this issue. I noticed strange loss growth and almost
 immediate fall back after I stoppped and run training again from last
 checkpoint.

 I can't switch to python2 as my development machine has Windows, and there
 are no tensorflow windows python2 support.

body:
Yes I have the same issue as well

Unfortunately, the loss growth is still there even when I run it with
python2

On Mon, 22 Jan 2018 at 6:02 PM, gloriouskilka <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> immediate fall back after I stoppped and run training again from last
> checkpoint.
>
> I can't switch to python2 as my development machine has Windows, and there
> are no tensorflow windows python2 support.
